primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The divine rescue of humanity from the legal and cosmic grip of Satan through the mechanism of the Incarnation and Resurrection.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Father willed to rescue us
God saved man... by buying him back
unwilling to extort anything by force, he rejected violence
satisfied all the requirements of justice
in the likeness of sinful flesh

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan / Death / The Law of Sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Satan is a legal adversary with a legitimate claim on humanity that only a divine ransom can satisfy.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the redeemed: ascending with Christ and offering children to God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Parent
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical response (offering children) is framed as a response to the primary soteriological act (God offering His Son).

voorbeelden_god_subject: he thereby destroyed the very death
he lowered himself to the point of paying a ransom
voorbeelden_mens_subject: let us strive to rise with him
we hesitate to consecrate our children

voorbeelden: he nevertheless willed to satisfy all the requirements of justice
he willingly made himself a slave
let us in turn strive to rise
Scripture assigns it no other meaning
I have the power to lay it down
One whom he could not subjugate

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God to overcome the 'Power' of Satan within the constraints of Justice.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the position of the 'Innocent Victim' to break the legal claim of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is an 'inevitability' and Satan's claim is 'strict justice'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in the rescue; man is the passive beneficiary of a cosmic legal victory.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We hesitate to consecrate our children to God

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God saved man, not by issuing a decree, but by buying him back.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; Christ is the ontological Head, not just a model.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the Head (1 Co 11:3) is a participatory reality, not an exemplary one.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe at being 'bought back' from a lost cause.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Passover' of Christ to the 'Passing over' of the believer is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The transition from the cosmic ransom to the specific exhortation about children feels slightly abrupt.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he lost the guilty one... having prosecuted the just one, he saw the criminal go free

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son and Father.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; sin creates a legal debt that man cannot pay.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: A classic Christus Victor narrative where God is the Subject and Satan is the Opponent.

modale_halans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Devoir (Justice) and Pouvoir (Omnipotence).
modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Could include more 'Vouloir' regarding the believer's transformation.
modale_halans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on the 'striving to rise' as a gift of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Satan is a formidable legal opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative engine while grounding ethics in the prior work of grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'ransom' metaphor; Greimas shows that the ransom is the 'Object' that mediates the Subject's victory.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the Greek 'Pasch'; Greimas shows how the definition of the word sets the 'Axis of Transmission'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Opponent' (Satan) is defeated by his own 'Savoir-faire' (legal knowledge) being turned against him.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Ransom Theory' of atonement which is structurally perfect for the Actantial Model.
